Container.Name: CodeServer
Container.Overview: Code-server(https://coder.com) is VS Code running on a remote server, accessible through the browser. - Code on your Chromebook, tablet, and laptop with a consistent dev environment. - If you have a Windows or Mac workstation, more easily develop for Linux. - Take advantage of large cloud servers to speed up tests, compilations, downloads, and more. - Preserve battery life when you're on the go. - All intensive computation runs on your server. - You're no longer running excess instances of Chrome.

Config.Name: PASSWORD
Config.Description: Optional web gui password, if `PASSWORD` or `HASHED_PASSWORD` is not provided, there will be no auth.

Config.Name: HASHED_PASSWORD
Config.Description: Optional web gui password, overrides `PASSWORD`, instructions on how to create it is below.

Config.Name: SUDO_PASSWORD
Config.Description: If this optional variable is set, user will have sudo access in the code-server terminal with the specified password.

Config.Name: SUDO_PASSWORD_HASH
Config.Description: Optionally set sudo password via hash (takes priority over `SUDO_PASSWORD` var). Format is `$type$salt$hashed`.

Config.Name: PROXY_DOMAIN
Config.Description: If this optional variable is set, this domain will be proxied for subdomain proxying. See Documentation(https://github.com/cdr/code-server/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md#sub-domains)

Config.Name: DEFAULT_WORKSPACE
Config.Description: If this optional variable is set, code-server will open this directory by default
